title: Sexual Assaults – Update/Public Assistance Requested
author: Winnipeg Police Service
description:
Members of the Sex Crimes Unit continue to investigate a number of sexual assaults between April and August 2021 on or around the Red River Trail System. 

The victims have been female (aged between 15 to late-30’s). During some of the incidents – the victims were grabbed from behind, pulled to the ground and threatened with a weapon.

The sexual assaults have occurred between the early evening (in the light) and the early morning (in the dark), and they have happened in a geographic area consisting of the west Red River trail from the Osborne Bridge, south along Churchill Drive, to the Elm Park footbridge at Jubilee Avenue.

There has been an increased police presence in the area and detectives have continued to investigate extensively.

On June 12 and August 9, the Winnipeg Police Service issued media advisories regarding the sexual assaults. We wish to thank those who shared the advisories and provided information – we received numerous tips that have helped the investigation.

Sex Crimes Unit investigators can now release surveillance video that shows a male person of interest. The male is described as being fair-skinned with brown or black-coloured hair. He was wearing all black – including a black face mask around his chin.

This investigation is continuing by members of the Sex Crimes Unit. Anyone with information that may assist investigators is asked to call the Sex Crimes Unit at 204-986-6245 or Crime Stoppers at 204-786-TIPS (8477).
